message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about energy balance and weight gain. If an organism consumes more calories than it burns off, it will inevitably gain weight and potentially become fatter. Option (B) is incorrect because running does not directly correlate with weight gain. Option (C) is incorrect because flying also does not directly correlate with weight gain. Option (D) is incorrect because weight gain does not necessarily lead to death.

This question is related to basic knowledge about energy balance and weight gain. If an organism consumes more calories than it burns off, it will store the excess calories as fat, leading to weight gain. Option (B) is incorrect because running does not necessarily address the excess calorie intake. Option (C) is unrelated to the question and is not related to weight gain. Option (D) is too extreme and does not account for other factors that may contribute to an organism's lifespan.

Option (C) is incorrect because flying does not directly address the issue of calorie intake and energy balance. Option (D) is incorrect because it is too extreme of an outcome and not directly related to the concept of calorie intake and energy balance.

When an organism consumes more calories than it burns off, it will accumulate excess energy in the form of stored fat, leading to weight gain and eventually making the organism fatter. Option (D) is incorrect because while long-term overconsumption of calories can lead to negative health consequences and potentially contribute to an increased risk of mortality, it does not directly address the immediate consequence of consuming more calories than burned off in terms of weight gain and getting fatter.

If an organism consumes more calories than it burns off through physical activity and metabolic processes, it will store the excess energy as fat and therefore, get fatter. Option (C) is incorrect unless the organism is capable of flight as part of its normal biological functions. Option (D) is not necessarily true as the consequences of consuming excess calories vary depending on the organism and other factors.
